page.title: 05WILDLIFE ON THE RIVER CALDEW
page.content: {FISH:}The main type of fish found in the River Caldew is trout. There used to be salmon but because of weirs they cannot get up the river to breed. The North West Water Board is hoping to rectify this. {BIRDS:}At Bridge End there is a heron and a few ducks. A kingfisher is known to be in this area too. {PLANTS:}The banks of the river are overgrown with plants. Trees there include willow (nearest the water), rowan trees and elderberry bushes (the berries of the two plants are often used for wine), birch and elm. {ANIMALS:}Otters have been seen. {CONSERVATION:}Near Gatesgill where Roe Beck joins the Caldew a conservation area is planned. At present it is an ox-bow lake. This will be fenced and a sluice gate fitted at one end. It will be flooded and ducks introduced.
